Summary: The 3 West Club is in an excellent location near Rockefeller Center and St. Patrick's Cathedral, offering clean, basic rooms without luxury amenities, and is noted for being a great value. The hotel has different-sized rooms, including suites that can accommodate families.

The 414 Hotel is near Times Square and Restaurant Row, with several reviewers noting its central location and proximity to restaurants and theaters; it is a smaller, European-style hotel with no elevator, free Wi-Fi, and a basic continental breakfast. Some reviewers mention the hotel's quiet rooms and helpful staff, while others note the small size of the rooms and the lack of amenities.
60 Thompson is a hotel in SoHo with a rooftop bar, a lobby bar, and a restaurant. The hotel is close to shopping, dining, and subway stations.

6 Columbus is a modern, boutique hotel conveniently located near Central Park and the Columbus Circle subway station, making it easy to explore the city. Rooms are on the smaller side, but clean and well-designed with comfortable beds, and some offer amenities like iPod docking stations and heated bathroom floors.

70 Park Avenue Hotel is located near Grand Central Station and provides a central location for midtown. The lobby is small, but the rooms are well-appointed with modern amenities such as flat-screen TVs and iPod docks.

The Ace Hotel has a cool, hipster vibe with a lively lobby scene, free wifi, and a convenient midtown location near Penn Station and several subway lines. Some rooms have unique features like guitars and record players, and the hotel offers takeout service from nearby restaurants.

This hotel is centrally located, within walking distance of many attractions and close to subway lines, making it easy to explore Manhattan. The rooms are spacious, some with kitchens and comfortable beds, and the staff is friendly and helpful.
This hotel is conveniently located near the subway and many attractions. It offers spacious rooms with kitchenettes, which can be handy for quick meals.

The Affinia Gardens offers spacious rooms with fully equipped kitchens, providing flexibility for meals and a comfortable extended stay. Its Upper East Side location provides a quiet, residential feel with easy access to Central Park and subway lines for exploring the city.

This hotel is in an ideal location near Penn Station with easy access to subways, and several subway lines either just across the road or a couple of blocks away. The reception staff were extremely helpful and provided maps, or gave information on restaurants and visiting tourist sites.

The Affinia Shelburne is centrally located near Grand Central station, allowing easy access to transportation and attractions, and offers clean, spacious rooms with kitchenettes and mini-fridges.  Some rooms have balconies and views of the Empire State Building and Chrysler Building.

AKA United Nations offers spacious, modern apartments with well-equipped kitchens and complimentary breakfast on weekdays; it's conveniently located near Grand Central Terminus and the UN, with a corner store nearby.

The Algonquin Hotel is centrally located near Times Square and Broadway, making it easy to explore the city, and offers a cozy atmosphere with a lively lobby bar and comfortable rooms, though some find the rooms small. It is close to subways and Grand Central Station.

The Americana Inn is a budget-friendly, centrally-located option in Midtown Manhattan, with small, clean rooms and shared bathrooms. It's within walking distance of major attractions like Times Square and has easy access to subways, making it convenient for exploring the city.

The Amsterdam Court Hotel is centrally located near Times Square and subway lines, but rooms are small, sometimes windowless, and may have noise issues. Some rooms have been renovated, but the hotel gets mixed reviews on cleanliness and staff helpfulness.

The Astor on the Park is a budget-friendly hotel near Central Park and subway lines, though a bit far from downtown; rooms are small, basic and clean, with staff noted as friendly and helpful. The hotel is popular with European guests, and offers vending machines and internet in the basement.

The Hotel Bedford is located near Grand Central Station, making it easy to get around the city, and many tourist attractions are within walking distance. Rooms include kitchenettes with refrigerators, microwaves, and coffee makers, and some rooms are spacious with multiple beds.

The Beekman Tower offers spacious suites with kitchens, providing a home-like feel and convenience for travelers; it is located in a quieter, residential part of midtown, near the UN, with easy access to transportation. Although some find the decor outdated, the hotel is praised for its friendly staff and clean rooms, offering a comfortable and affordable option for exploring Manhattan.

The Belleclaire Hotel on the Upper West Side is near the subway and Central Park, offering economy rooms with shared bathrooms as well as suites with private bathrooms; some rooms have kitchenettes with a fridge. The hotel is noted for clean rooms, friendly staff, and proximity to restaurants and grocery stores, but some guests have reported noise and small rooms.

The Bentley Hotel has modern and clean rooms with great views, but is a bit far from the subway and centrally located attractions, though a bus stops right outside. Reviewers note it is located in a quiet, safe, residential neighborhood near the East River, with several restaurants and bars nearby.

This hotel is located in Chinatown/Little Italy with easy access to multiple subway lines, making it easy to get around the city. It offers clean, modern rooms with comfortable beds, free WiFi, and complimentary breakfast.

This hotel is a clean, basic option with small rooms, free breakfast, and easy access to the Javits Center. It is located in an industrial area a 10-15 minute walk from Times Square and the subway, with a 24-hour auto shop across the street.

The Best Western Hospitality House offers apartment-style rooms with full kitchens and separate living areas, suitable for longer stays and groups. It is centrally located in midtown Manhattan near major attractions and subway lines, although street noise may be a concern for some guests.

The Seaport Inn is located in the South Street Seaport area, near the Brooklyn Bridge, Financial District, and subway, with cobblestone streets and many nearby bars, cafes, and restaurants. Some rooms have views of the Brooklyn Bridge, and the hotel offers free and fast internet service.

The Blue Moon Hotel is a small, renovated tenement building with unique, spacious rooms and a historical New York atmosphere, located in the Lower East Side near various cultural neighborhoods and subway lines. The hotel offers complimentary breakfast, free wifi, and personable service, with some rooms featuring balconies and views of the city.

Broadway Plaza Hotel is centrally located near the subway, with clean, spacious rooms, and offers complimentary breakfast and 24/7 coffee. It's in the garment district, which may be quiet or deserted at night, but is within walking distance to major attractions.

The Buckingham Hotel offers spacious suites with kitchenettes, making it convenient for longer stays and travelers who prefer to prepare their own meals; it is centrally located near Central Park and subway lines. Some rooms are old-fashioned and can be noisy.
This hotel offers suite-style rooms with a full kitchen, full-sized refrigerator, free laundry, and free Wi-Fi. It's located a 5-10 minute walk from Times Square and close to public transportation.

The Carlton Arms is an affordable, centrally-located hotel known for its unique, artist-designed rooms. It is near subways, restaurants, and bars, but lacks amenities like TVs, and some rooms can be noisy.

The Carvi Hotel is a small, new, and clean hotel with comfortable beds, marble bathrooms, and flat-screen TVs. It is conveniently located near subway lines and has amenities like a fridge, safety deposit box, and coffee maker in some rooms.

This hotel is steps from Times Square and offers free breakfast, 24/7 coffee and snacks, and evening wine and cheese in Ricks Cafe, making it easy to grab food and drinks at any time. The hotel's central location also provides easy access to subway lines for spontaneous exploration.
Chambers Hotel is a modern, stylish boutique hotel with small rooms and a fantastic shower. It is centrally located near Fifth Avenue shopping and Central Park, with a hip bar and restaurant.

The Chelsea Lodge is a budget-friendly option in the Chelsea neighborhood with clean, small rooms, shared bathrooms, and proximity to subway lines, restaurants, and shops, making it a convenient base for exploring the city. Some suites have kitchenettes and garden access for a more independent experience.

Chelsea Pines Inn is conveniently located near subway lines and within walking distance of Chelsea, Greenwich Village, and the Meatpacking District, with many reviewers citing easy access to transportation and key areas; it offers a continental breakfast, free wifi, and a business center. The inn has a 24-hour front desk, and while there's no elevator, some staff are available to assist with luggage.

The Chelsea Savoy Hotel is conveniently located near subway lines, making it easy to get around the city, and offers basic amenities. Some guests found the hotel clean and a great value for the location.

This hotel's central location provides easy access to Times Square, Grand Central, and various subway lines, with some reviewers noting quick check-in and check-out processes. Some reviewers received complimentary internet passes and were able to check in early.

The Solita Soho Hotel is located at the intersection of Chinatown, Little Italy and Soho, near multiple subway stops, which is convenient for exploring downtown Manhattan. Rooms are small, but clean and modern, with flat-screen TVs and free internet access.

Club Quarters Downtown is known for its convenient location near subway lines and Wall Street, with clean, modern rooms. It provides amenities like free Wi-Fi, and a fitness room and is suitable for short stays.

Club Quarters Midtown offers a great location near Times Square and other attractions, with clean, modern rooms, though some find them small; it caters to business travelers with amenities like free WiFi and a lounge with computers, but with limited service. The hotel's central location and no-frills approach make it suitable for travelers who prioritize convenience and affordability over luxury amenities.

This hotel offers a prime location near Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall, and 5th Avenue, with clean, modern rooms suitable for short stays. It provides conveniences such as free Wi-Fi, bottled water, and a 7th-floor lounge with internet access and a terrace.

The Comfort Inn Chelsea is centrally located near the Flatiron Building and multiple subway lines, making it easy to get around Manhattan. Rooms include a safe, refrigerator, and free wifi, with a complimentary breakfast available.

This hotel has a great central location with easy access to many attractions, including Macy's and the Empire State Building, and has complimentary breakfast and free Internet. It is noted to be a smaller, older property with some rooms having views of the Empire State Building.

The Comfort Inn Manhattan Bridge is a new and clean hotel in Chinatown with easy access to multiple subway lines, Little Italy, and other downtown attractions. It offers free Wi-Fi, complimentary breakfast, and compact rooms, with some rooms featuring views of the Manhattan Bridge.

This reasonably priced hotel is in an unbeatable location right off Times Square and close to subway lines for easy access to other attractions, and rooms include free wireless internet. Several reviewers mention the availability of a business center with computers and printers for guest use and say that the staff is friendly and helpful.

The hotel is in the Theater District near Times Square and subway/bus stops, and offers free high-speed Wi-Fi, a computer with internet and printer in the lobby, and a complimentary continental breakfast. Some rooms are small, and there is only one elevator for the 7-story building.
The Comfort Inn is centrally located, within walking distance of Times Square, and offers free breakfast, but rooms can be small. It is near public transportation, making it easy to get around.

The hotel is in a central location, close to Times Square, the subway, and the Port Authority Bus Terminal, making it convenient for exploring the city. Rooms are small but clean, modern, and well-equipped, and the hotel offers complimentary breakfast.

The hotel has a trendy, modern design with small rooms, floor-to-ceiling windows and no traditional front desk, offering a unique check-in experience in a living room-like setting. It is conveniently located near the East Village with access to subway lines and various restaurants and bars, making it easy to explore the city.

The Cosmopolitan Hotel is a clean, basic hotel in Tribeca with a subway station right outside, making it easy to explore Manhattan.  Rooms can be small and noisy, but the location and price make it a reasonable option for budget-conscious travelers.
This Courtyard is located near Times Square and subway stations, making it easy to get around Manhattan quickly. The hotel offers free Wi-Fi and a business center.

The Courtyard Upper East Side is a clean and modern hotel with comfortable beds and a gym and pool. It is located in a quiet, residential area, a 10-15 minute walk to the subway, and offers free Wi-Fi.

The Courtyard Marriott Fifth Avenue is centrally located near attractions like Times Square and Grand Central Station, with a deli next door open 24/7. Some rooms are small, but they offer free internet access and a business center.

This hotel is conveniently located near a subway station, allowing for easy access to various parts of Manhattan, and offers quick check-in/out services. It also has a 24-hour pharmacy next door and provides free coffee and tea on the 12th floor.

The Crosby Street Hotel is located in the heart of SoHo, near subway and bus lines, and offers amenities such as a bar with a selection of over 400 bottles, a restaurant with delicious wines, and proximity to Broadway. The hotel features individually designed rooms, tall warehouse-style windows, and oak-tree floors.

The Crowne Plaza Times Square is in a central location with easy access to subway stations and Broadway, and offers a concierge service and a buzzy bar. It may not be suitable for those seeking quiet as it is located in a busy area.

The Da Vinci Hotel offers a central location near Times Square and Central Park, with small but clean rooms. It provides basic amenities like free internet access and a simple breakfast, suitable for travelers focused on exploring the city.

This hotel is in Times Square, near the subway, making it easy to access different parts of the city, and also has 2-room suites, with a fridge and microwave. It is close to shopping, restaurants, and entertainment.

This hotel is clean and modern, with small rooms that are well-appointed, and is located within walking distance of Penn Station, Times Square, and other attractions. There are only two elevators, which can result in long wait times, and internet access is not free.

This hotel is centrally located near a subway station and many attractions, making it easy to get around Manhattan. The rooms are noted as clean and comfortable, with some offering city views, and though small, are a good value for the location.

This trendy and modern hotel is centrally located near Times Square and Central Park, with subway access, a rooftop bar, and clean, though small, rooms. It may appeal to younger travelers seeking a hip atmosphere.

Duane Street Hotel is ideally located in lower Manhattan near major subway lines, providing easy access to various parts of the city. The hotel's location allows for walking distance to SoHo, Tribeca, and the financial district, making it convenient for exploring different neighborhoods.

The Dylan Hotel is located near Grand Central Terminal, Times Square, and the theater district, making it easy to access transportation and tourist attractions. Some rooms include amenities like iPod docking stations, and the hotel offers free wireless internet.

This hotel offers spacious rooms with kitchenettes, making it suitable for longer stays and saving on dining costs, and is conveniently located near Grand Central Station for easy access to transportation. The Eastgate Tower offers clean rooms and coin-operated laundry in the basement, and is near grocery stores and various restaurants.

The Econo Lodge Times Square offers a great location near Times Square, subways, and restaurants, with clean, small rooms suitable for sleeping, plus complimentary breakfast, coffee, and tea; bear in mind that the rooms may be noisy, and luggage storage incurs a fee.

This hotel is located in lower Manhattan, a 10-minute walk to the subway, near the Hudson River, and offers free breakfast and evening drinks. The hotel has spacious rooms with separate living areas, microwave, and access to a gym, and is close to the WTC site, shops, and restaurants.

The Empire Hotel is located near Central Park and Lincoln Center, with easy access to subway lines and many shops and restaurants; it has a trendy lobby, comfortable beds, and offers free wireless internet. Some rooms are small, and can be noisy, but it has a rooftop bar that attracts a trendy crowd.

Envoy Club offers spacious studio and apartment-style rooms with fully equipped kitchens, providing a home-away-from-home experience for travelers. The hotel is located within walking distance of attractions like the Empire State Building and offers amenities such as a rooftop deck and fitness center.

The hotel is centrally located near Wall St and the South Street Seaport, with subway access and proximity to attractions like Battery Park and Ground Zero. Rooms are large for NYC standards, with amenities like a fridge, microwave, and free internet access.

The Excelsior Hotel is located in the Upper West Side, near Central Park and subway lines, providing easy access to the city. The rooms are clean and comfortable but may be small, and some guests have noted issues with the friendliness of the front desk staff.
This new hotel is centrally located near Times Square and the subway, offering free internet and breakfast. Rooms are small but clean and comfortable, though the surrounding street is a bit gritty.
The Fitzpatrick Grand Central is centrally located near Grand Central Station, making it easy to get around Manhattan. The hotel offers clean, comfortable rooms and a friendly staff.
The Fitzpatrick Manhattan is located on Lexington Avenue near shopping, museums, and transportation. Rooms include amenities such as mini-fridges and comfortable beds.
The hotel is centrally located near Times Square, Rockefeller Center, and subway stations. Rooms include a fridge and microwave which would be useful for spontaneous travelers.

This hotel has small but well-equipped rooms, free wired internet, and is located close to subway lines, making it easy to get around the city. The hotel is in Chelsea, within walking distance to many attractions.

The hotel is located near multiple subway lines providing easy access to various parts of the city, and is within walking distance of SoHo and Greenwich Village shops and restaurants. The hotel offers free WiFi and a small gym, and rooms have Starbucks coffee.

The hotel is conveniently located near Times Square and major subway lines, making it easy to access various parts of Manhattan. Guests can enjoy free high-speed internet, and the hotel offers discounted parking at a nearby lot.

The Four Seasons New York offers a prime location near Central Park and Fifth Avenue shopping, with spacious rooms and attentive concierge services that can provide quick recommendations and arrangements. Some reviewers mentioned services like pressing and transportation being readily available, along with the possibility of upgrades, which could appeal to spontaneous plans.

Gild Hall is located in the Financial District close to subway lines, making it easy to get around the city. Rooms feature modern amenities and comfortable beds and some reviewers note the area is quiet at night.

Gramercy Park Hotel is known for its trendy and hip atmosphere, with a popular bar scene that requires reservations, as well as a rooftop bar exclusive to hotel guests. The hotel provides quick access to the private Gramercy Park and offers various amenities such as iPod docking stations and DVD rentals, and is located in a quiet area close to transportation.

This hotel offers a great location next to Grand Central Station with access to several subway lines, making it convenient for exploring various parts of Manhattan. Travelers can quickly access Times Square, the Chrysler Building, and other attractions.

The Greenwich Hotel offers a relaxing and stylish experience with a mellow vibe, complimentary snacks and non-alcoholic drinks, and a location in a quiet part of Greenwich near restaurants and cafes. The hotel also features a gym, spa, and courtyard.

This Hampton Inn is centrally located near Penn Station, Macy's, and Times Square, with a subway station close by, making it easy to explore the city. The hotel offers free Wi-Fi, complimentary breakfast, and a business center, with clean and modern rooms that may be small.

This Hampton Inn offers a central location near Penn Station, Times Square, and major attractions, with easy access to subway lines for spontaneous exploration. Free breakfast and internet are included, and rooms are clean and comfortable, though small.

The Hampton Inn Chelsea is conveniently located near subway lines and within walking distance of attractions like Times Square and Madison Square Garden. It offers amenities such as free breakfast, Wi-Fi, and a fitness room, suitable for a traveler looking for ease of access and essential services.

The Hampton Inn Soho offers a convenient location near subways, shopping, dining, and various downtown neighborhoods, with compact but clean rooms and complimentary breakfast. Some rooms have city views, and the hotel provides free internet access.

The hotel is in a convenient location near Times Square and Broadway, with easy access to subway and transportation, but the immediate surrounding area is considered by some to be less desirable. The hotel has small rooms, free breakfast, and amenities such as internet and business center.

The hotel is in a convenient location near the subway, the Seaport, and various downtown attractions, making it easy to explore the city. There is free breakfast and internet, and rooms have comfortable beds and flat-screen TVs.

The Helmsley Middletowne is an older, centrally located hotel with large rooms and a small lobby, offering a basic continental breakfast and proximity to major attractions like Times Square and Grand Central Station. Rooms may be dated, but the hotel provides a clean, functional space for sightseeing and shopping in Midtown Manhattan.

The hotel is in a central Manhattan location near a train station, Times Square, and Central Park. Select rooms include complimentary breakfast, wireless access, a cocktail reception, and access to a gym and business center.

This hotel is centrally located with subway stations nearby, making it easy to get around Manhattan, and rooms include a refrigerator, microwave, and free wired/wireless internet. The hotel is also within walking distance of many attractions like Times Square, Macy's, and the Empire State Building.

This Hilton Garden Inn is centrally located near the subway, Macy's, Times Square, and other attractions, making it easy to explore the city. The rooms include a fridge, microwave, and free Wi-Fi, and there is also a business center for printing boarding passes and a pantry in the lobby.

The Hilton Garden Inn Times Square offers a convenient location near Times Square and subway lines, with amenities like free Wi-Fi, microwaves, and refrigerators in the rooms. Its central location and business-friendly amenities cater to travelers with busy schedules.

The Hilton Garden Inn Tribeca is conveniently located near multiple subway lines, including one directly outside, providing easy access to various parts of the city. It offers amenities such as free internet, a refrigerator, and a microwave, and is within walking distance of several neighborhoods like Soho, Chinatown, and Tribeca.

This hotel is centrally located near many subway stations and tourist attractions like Central Park and Times Square. The hotel has a zip check-in and luggage drop-off for a fee and is generally busy.

Located in the heart of Times Square, this hotel is close to subway lines for easy access to public transportation around New York. The hotel is also within walking distance of many major attractions and theaters.

This hotel has small, modern, and clean rooms and is located close to many attractions like Times Square, Rockefeller Center, and Central Park. It offers free Wi-Fi, and a free breakfast that includes hot items, which allows travelers to quickly start their day.

This Holiday Inn Express is located a short walk from Times Square, Penn Station, and the Port Authority bus terminal, with subways nearby. It offers free breakfast and internet, and rooms have air conditioning and coffee pots.
This hotel is centrally located near Penn Station, Times Square, and the subway. Rooms are small, but clean, and include complimentary breakfast and free WiFi.
This Holiday Inn is located in Chinatown, close to the subway, with generally clean rooms. It's near several vibrant areas like Little Italy and Soho, making it convenient for exploring.

This Holiday Inn is a budget-friendly option with clean, spacious rooms, though some find the decor outdated; its central location provides easy access to Central Park, Times Square, and subway lines, making it suitable for tourists exploring the city. Note that some guests have reported slow elevators and noise issues.

This hotel is in a great central location, close to subway, Madison Square Garden, and Penn Station; the rooms are small but clean and modern. The staff are friendly and helpful, and guests can enjoy free internet and a small gym.

Hotel 17 is a budget-friendly hotel in the Gramercy Park neighborhood, near Union Square and subway lines, with small, clean rooms and shared bathrooms that are also kept clean. Rooms have a sink and mirror, and the hotel's location provides easy access to downtown Manhattan.

Hotel 31 is a budget-friendly option in Midtown Manhattan with small, clean rooms and shared bathrooms, near the Empire State Building and subway. The hotel has a retro feel and is within walking distance to many attractions.

Hotel 373 offers a central location near attractions like the Empire State Building and Times Square, with compact, clean rooms suitable for short stays. It's adjacent to a Starbucks and various eateries, providing convenient options for quick meals and coffee.

Hotel 41 is centrally located near Times Square and subway lines, making it easy to explore NYC, and offers amenities such as free wifi, DVD rentals, and breakfast. The rooms are small, but clean and modern, with helpful staff available.

Hotel 99, located on the Upper West Side, offered modern rooms equipped with flat-screen TVs and free internet access. It was undergoing renovations during the review period, with some floors still under construction and the elevator not yet operational.

The Hotel Beacon offers apartment-style rooms with kitchenettes, providing a home-away-from-home experience, and is located in the Upper West Side, near the subway for easy access to the city. The nearby 24-hour market and flexible room options cater to travelers seeking convenience and independence.

Hotel Chandler is praised for its central Midtown location, near the Empire State Building and subway lines, making it easy to explore Manhattan. The hotel offers comfortable, clean rooms with modern amenities, though some rooms are small and may have limited views.

Hotel Deauville is a budget-friendly, centrally located hotel near the subway, with small, clean rooms and helpful staff. It is within walking distance of major attractions like the Empire State Building and offers free Wi-Fi.
The hotel's location is convenient to subway stations, Soho, Little Italy, and the East and West Village. They offer complimentary breakfast and internet access.

This hotel is conveniently located near attractions and the subway, with rooms offering complimentary high-speed internet access. Guests can enjoy a continental breakfast, all-day beverages, and an afternoon wine and cheese hour in the club room.

This trendy hotel is in the Meatpacking District, near restaurants, shops, and nightlife, with a rooftop bar, and easy access to subway lines, and cabs. Some rooms have balconies, and some guests report noise at night.

This hotel is well-located between uptown and downtown with access to the subway and has 24/7 coffee and tea, newspapers, and free internet. It offers the flexibility of included breakfast and evening wine and cheese.

The Grand Union Hotel is centrally located, near subway lines and landmarks like the Empire State Building, offering budget-friendly accommodations with clean rooms and helpful staff. It may not be luxurious, but it is a practical base for exploring the city.

Hotel Indigo offers a modern, minimalist design with spacious rooms for NYC, featuring comfortable beds, Aveda toiletries, and large flat-screen TVs; its location is convenient to subway lines, Times Square, and other attractions. However, some rooms lack amenities like coffee makers and luggage racks.

Hotel Mela is located near Times Square and public transportation, though the rooms are small and known to have thin walls. It is known for its modern and clean rooms, accommodating staff, and a restaurant next door with room service.

The Hotel Metro is in a great central location near transportation, Macy's, and the Empire State Building, and it has a complimentary breakfast, free wifi, and a rooftop bar/terrace that may be ideal for spontaneous travelers. Some rooms were spacious, although others were small, and the fitness center could also be an asset for travelers.

Hotel Newton is a budget-friendly hotel near the 96th Street subway station, providing quick access to Times Square and other attractions. Some rooms include a fridge and microwave, and the surrounding area has shops, diners, and cafes.

This hotel is located in the Lower East Side and has a trendy bar and restaurant. The hotel has comfortable beds, and modern room designs with floor-to-ceiling windows that provide great views, and free WiFi.
Hotel Reserve is a smaller, modern hotel in the Financial District near several subway lines, making it easy to get around the city. Rooms have comfortable beds, flat-screen TVs, and free Wi-Fi.
The St. James Hotel is a budget-friendly option with an amazing central location near Times Square, offering clean and basic rooms. The hotel's excellent location caters to spontaneous travelers.

The Stanford Hotel is in midtown Manhattan, close to Penn Station, subways, Times Square, and shopping, and offers small, clean rooms with a refrigerator and free continental breakfast. There is only one slow elevator for all floors.

Hotel Wales is a smaller, quaint hotel located on the Upper East Side, near Central Park and museums, with a rooftop terrace; rooms can be small, and some have noisy AC units. Continental breakfast is offered, and the hotel provides a common area with computers and internet access.
This trendy hotel has a great bar and lobby scene, and is conveniently located near Central Park and the subway. Although the rooms are small, they have a unique, hip style and provide ipod docks.

Ink48 offers large rooms with city or Hudson River views, and is located a 10-15 minute walk from Times Square and the theater district. It's near Hell's Kitchen restaurants, with easy cab access for exploring different parts of the city.

The Inn offers a "home away from home" experience with apartment-style suites, kitchens stocked with complimentary snacks and drinks, and a location near the subway for quick access to Times Square and other attractions. With no set check-in or check-out schedule, and close proximity to the subway, this location can be ideal for flexible travel schedules.

The Intercontinental Barclay offers a midtown Manhattan location close to Grand Central Station, with generally clean rooms and quick elevator service, though some report small bathrooms. The hotel's location provides easy access to delis and various dining options, especially for breakfast.
The hotel's location is convenient to many attractions and the subway. They also offer a car service that will transport you FOC 10 blocks.

The Kitano is centrally located near Grand Central Station, making it easy to walk to many attractions, and provides a quiet, clean room to relax. Some reviewers mentioned the availability of umbrellas and tea makers in the rooms, while others noted the hotel's jazz bar.

La Quinta Manhattan is in a central midtown location close to subway lines, Penn Station, Times Square, and the Empire State Building. The hotel offers free amenities such as breakfast and internet and has a rooftop bar with views.

Lafayette House is a boutique hotel in a townhouse, offering large, uniquely decorated rooms with sitting areas and fireplaces, some with kitchenettes and courtyard access. It is located in the East Village, near restaurants and attractions, but operates without 24/7 concierge service.

This hotel has a perfect central location near shopping, broadway and Central Park, and is accessible to subway stations, allowing for easy travel to other locations.  Some rooms include work spaces, and helpful staff.

The Library Hotel offers a convenient Midtown location near Grand Central Station, allowing for easy access to transportation and various NYC sites, plus free amenities like breakfast, wine/cheese evenings, and 24/7 coffee and snacks. With its cozy rooms and friendly staff, the hotel provides a welcoming atmosphere and personalized service for travelers looking for a comfortable and central base to explore the city.

The hotel is located in the Upper East Side, close to Central Park, shopping on Madison and 5th Avenue, and subway stations, with spacious rooms and friendly staff. Some rooms have kitchenettes, and it's known for being pet-friendly.

The Lowell is a small, intimate hotel on the Upper East Side, near Central Park and Madison Avenue shopping, with rooms that include kitchenettes and terraces. It is known for its quiet atmosphere and attentive staff, though some found the lobby and hallways to be small and dark.

This hotel is located at Columbus Circle in the Time Warner building, providing access to shops and restaurants, and is near Central Park and subway lines for convenient access to other attractions. Room service is available, and the business center is open all night.

The Milford Plaza is centrally located near Times Square, Broadway shows, and public transportation, but rooms are small and somewhat outdated. The hotel has a fast elevator system and offers luggage storage for a fee after checkout.

The Millenium Hilton is conveniently located near subway lines and PATH trains making it easy to get around Manhattan, and offers amenities such as a fitness center, pool, and restaurant. Some rooms offer city views, and there is free airline check-in in the lobby.
This hotel is located in Times Square and offers a good location for a traveler. Some rooms may be small, but have all the necessities.

The Millennium UN Plaza offers large, clean rooms with outstanding city views and a pool, located a short walk from Grand Central Station and the subway. Note that some rooms are dated and minibar access may be restricted.

The Moderne Hotel is centrally located near Times Square and Central Park, with subway access, making it easy to explore the city, and offers a 24/7 coffee and tea lounge. Rooms are small, and some lack natural light and views.

Morgans Hotel is centrally located near Grand Central Station and other attractions, with a convenient continental breakfast, a gym, and a living room area with coffee, tea, and magazines. The hotel has friendly staff, though the rooms may be small and internet access is not free.

Murray Hill East Suites offers spacious rooms with kitchenettes, making it convenient for quick meals and storing snacks. The hotel's location near Grand Central Station provides easy access to transportation and various attractions.

Murray Hill Inn is a budget-friendly hotel in midtown Manhattan, with small but clean rooms and a good location near subway stations and major attractions. There is no elevator, and some rooms may be noisy or have limited views.

The hotel is near several subway lines providing easy access to other parts of Manhattan, and it's close to the WTC site, Battery Park, and the Staten Island Ferry. The hotel provides clean, comfortable rooms, though some found them dated, and is a good value compared to midtown hotels.

This hotel is centrally located with subway access, making it easy to explore midtown Manhattan and access major attractions. While some rooms are small and the hotel is undergoing renovations, the staff is generally friendly and helpful.

The Marriott Marquis is located in Times Square, close to Broadway shows and subway lines, making it easy to get around Manhattan. Many reviewers highlight the hotel's cleanliness, spacious rooms, and efficient elevator system.

This hotel offers a convenient Midtown location near major attractions and transportation, allowing for easy exploration of the city. Rooms have very comfortable beds and blackout curtains to accommodate any schedule, but there may be street noise at lower levels.

The Night Hotel is a trendy, small boutique hotel with a location right off Times Square that has iPod docks and flat-screen TVs in the rooms, and a small bar. The rooms are small, and past guests have noted issues with thin walls and loud air conditioning, but there is a 24-hour deli across the street.

This hotel is centrally located near Broadway and Times Square, and is within walking distance of many attractions. Guests appreciated the clean, spacious rooms, easy access to transportation, and the many nearby dining options.

Off Soho Suites offers affordable, apartment-style suites with kitchenettes and multiple subway connections, making it easy to explore various neighborhoods. The location is near Chinatown, Little Italy, and Soho.

This hotel is centrally located near shops and transportation, with Select Guest perks like free Wi-Fi and morning beverage service. The hotel offers valet parking and quick access to major attractions such as Times Square and Central Park.

This hotel is located in the Upper West Side and is close to subway stations for easy travel around the city. The rooms are modern and stylish, with a good-sized TV and comfortable beds, though some reviewers note the rooms are small.

Park 79 Hotel is in a great location near Central Park and subway lines, though the rooms can be small, with thin walls, and shared bathrooms. The staff is generally helpful, and the hotel offers free Wi-Fi and morning coffee.

The Park Central Hotel is in an excellent, central location, close to the subway and within walking distance of major attractions like Central Park and Times Square. Some rooms include amenities like a safe, coffee maker, and HD TV.
This hotel is conveniently located near the subway and within walking distance to many attractions, but rooms are small. A free breakfast and sometimes free internet are included.
The Peninsula offers a pool open until 9:30 pm, a rooftop bar, and a location convenient to shopping and major sights. Some reviewers noted the hotel's gym and spa facilities.

The Phillips Club offers studio, one, and two-bedroom apartments with kitchens that can be rented by the day, week, or month. It is conveniently located near the 1 and 9 train and several bus lines, providing easy access to transportation.

The Plaza Athenee is a smaller, intimate hotel with a residential feel located on the Upper East Side, close to Central Park and Madison Avenue shops. Staff are attentive and the hotel has a cozy bar, with some rooms being spacious and quiet.

This hotel is well-situated for shopping and sightseeing, with easy access to the subway, Times Square, and Penn Station; Note that many guests report small rooms, dated decor, and slow check-in, but also highlight friendly and helpful staff. Internet access is available, though the signal can be unreliable.

This hotel is conveniently located near the subway, Empire State Building, and other attractions, and offers free Wi-Fi and breakfast. The rooms are small but clean, making it a good value for a no-frills stay in Manhattan.

This hotel offers a central location close to transportation and attractions like Times Square, Penn Station, and the Empire State Building, and provides clean, basic rooms with complimentary breakfast and sometimes free Wi-Fi. Reviews mention the convenience for walking, subway access, and luggage storage, though some note potential noise and slow elevators.

Hotel 57, now a Renaissance property, boasts a prime Midtown location near shopping, Central Park, and subway lines, though rooms are typically small. Recent renovations provide a modern, intimate boutique experience, and some rooms offer terraces, but note that some found the service inconsistent.

The Renaissance Times Square is in a great central location near many attractions, and has fast check-in; it is also near public transport like tour buses and subway stations. The hotel offers amenities like luggage holding, bellhops, and friendly staff who can give helpful advice or arrange transportation.

This hotel offers kitchenettes, free Wi-Fi, and a complimentary breakfast, and is centrally located near many attractions and subway stations, making it easy to explore Manhattan. The rooms have comfortable beds and there is a lounge for relaxing.

The Ritz-Carlton Battery Park is a quiet hotel located at the southern tip of Manhattan, near the subway, which provides access to midtown. The hotel offers harbor view rooms with telescopes, a gym, and town car service.

This hotel is centrally located near Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall, and 5th Avenue, with easy access to many attractions and subway lines; it features small but modern rooms with amenities like free WiFi, flatscreen TVs, and coffee makers, with self-service check-in kiosks for efficient service. Some rooms have kitchenettes with a fridge and microwave.

The Roger Smith Hotel is centrally located near Grand Central Station and offers unique, spacious rooms with free Wi-Fi, with some rooms including kitchenettes and separate living areas. The hotel has a restaurant and bar and provides free computer access in the lobby.

This trendy boutique hotel in Midtown Manhattan offers clean, comfortable rooms, free WiFi, and a convenient location near the subway, Empire State Building, and other attractions. The hotel's service is friendly and efficient, making it a great spot for a traveler who needs to be on the go.

Room Mate Grace is a small, trendy, European-style boutique hotel located near Times Square with clean, compact rooms, free Wi-Fi, and a 24-hour snack kiosk. It features a pool/bar area that is open to the public on weekends and a continental breakfast served until noon.

The Royalton Hotel is centrally located near Times Square, Broadway, and 5th Avenue, with a trendy bar and restaurant and a lobby that acts as a popular social space. Rooms are modern and comfortable but may be small, and are noted for fireplaces, large bathtubs, and iPod docks, and the hotel is known for a generally hip and dark atmosphere.

The Salisbury Hotel is in a great location, close to subway stops and within walking distance of Central Park and Times Square; rooms include a mini-fridge, and coffee maker; no long-term commitments required. This hotel is known for large rooms, a $4 breakfast, and friendly service.

The San Carlos Hotel offers spacious suites with kitchenettes, including microwaves and refrigerators, and is conveniently located near subways and major attractions, making it easy to explore the city. The hotel also provides free Wi-Fi, a business center with computers, and a gym.

Seafarers International House offers budget-friendly accommodation in a prime location near Union Square, with easy access to subway lines and various shops and restaurants. Rooms are basic and clean, with options for private or shared bathrooms, and amenities include free internet access and luggage storage.

This hotel is conveniently located near Times Square and subway lines, making it easy to explore the city, though some guests mention the hotel is large, busy, and impersonal. Amenities such as internet access may come with extra fees.

The Skyline Hotel is within walking distance to many attractions such as Times Square, Broadway, and Central Park, and near several subway stations, making it easy to get around the city. Rooms are spacious, clean and have comfortable beds and staff are friendly and helpful.

The Smyth Tribeca is conveniently located near multiple subway lines, including one right outside the door, making it easy to explore different parts of the city. The hotel also offers quick access to nearby neighborhoods such as SoHo and the West Village.
The Sofitel New York is centrally located in midtown Manhattan, close to Times Square and Grand Central Station. It offers free internet in the lobby and quick room service.

The Soho Grand is located in the heart of SoHo near subway lines, trendy shops, restaurants, and nightlife, but rooms are small. The hotel offers amenities such as a 24-hour gym, a lobby bar, and pet-friendly accommodations.

This hotel is located in the Meatpacking District, surrounded by bars, restaurants, and clubs, and the area is busy until late at night. It offers a rooftop pool and bar, free wi-fi, and some rooms include a selection of DVDs and games.

The Stay Hotel is located close to Times Square and subway lines, and has a trendy lobby with a bar that turns into a nightclub on weekends. The rooms are small, and some guests have noted noise issues from the club and thin walls, but free internet access is available in the lobby.

The Alex Hotel generally has clean, modern rooms, some with kitchens including a full-sized refrigerator, and is centrally located near Grand Central station, with delis and diners nearby. Some reviewers note quick room service, a fitness center, and a business center, but also mention small rooms, additional fees, and potentially noisy surroundings.

This hotel is in a convenient Midtown location near Times Square with a helpful staff, but it is noted that the elevators are slow. Many rooms include kitchenettes with microwaves and refrigerators, and guests can easily walk to the Theater District and Restaurant Row.

The Benjamin offers a central Midtown location with subway access, nearby restaurants, and attractions like Rockefeller Center and Times Square within walking distance; select rooms include kitchenettes with full-sized refrigerators and microwaves, in-room printers, and fax machines. Some reviewers noted noise from Lexington Avenue, and limited elevator access.

The Blakely Hotel offers a central Midtown location near transportation (subway), Times Square, and Central Park, with kitchenettes, microwaves, and refrigerators in the rooms. It also provides complimentary Wi-Fi and a free laptop in the lobby.

The Bowery Hotel offers a great downtown location within walking distance of SoHo and the East Village, and it is easily accessible to the rest of the city by cabs and subways. The hotel is also known for friendly service, comfortable rooms, and unique decor.

The Bryant Park Hotel offers a central Manhattan location near Bryant Park and major attractions like Times Square and Grand Central, with easy access to subway lines. It features modern, minimalist rooms, a popular Cellar Bar, and a Japanese restaurant, but note that some rooms may be noisy.

Carlton on Madison is centrally located near subway lines and attractions like the Empire State Building and Union Square, but some rooms are small and may have noise issues. The hotel has ongoing renovations, and some report slow elevators and mixed experiences with staff.

The Carlyle is located in the Upper East Side and near Central Park, with many high-end boutiques within walking distance. Some rooms are small and outdated, but the hotel has a bar and restaurants, and staff provide good service.

The Franklin Hotel is located on the Upper East Side, near the 86th street subway stop, museums, and Central Park. It offers complimentary breakfast, wine and cheese in the evening, and free internet access, but rooms are small.

The French Quarters Guest Apartments is in a central location on Restaurant Row, near Times Square and subway lines, with rooms that include kitchenettes and free Wi-Fi. The hotel offers a continental breakfast and has friendly staff, though some rooms may experience noise from the bar below.

The Gem Hotel Chelsea offers compact, modern rooms with amenities like free Wi-Fi and comfortable beds, situated in a convenient Chelsea location near subway access, restaurants, and attractions. The hotel provides a clean and functional space, suitable for short stays and travelers who prioritize location and value over spacious accommodations.

The hotel is located within walking distance of Penn Station, Times Square, and many shops, with the nearest subway station a short walk away. Rooms are small but clean and modern, with comfortable beds and amenities like free WiFi, flatscreen TVs, and coffee makers.

The hotel is located at the corner of SoHo, Little Italy, and the Lower East Side, close to subways and within walking distance of many attractions. Rooms include a mini fridge, microwave, free wireless internet, and coffee percolators.
The Grant Hotel is a budget-friendly option near the subway, with small rooms, shared bathrooms, and amenities like TV and AC. Some rooms have been updated, and the staff is generally helpful.

This Hampton Inn's location is convenient to major attractions and transit, and they offer 24/7 coffee, quick check-in, luggage storage, and breakfast to go. Some reviewers mentioned booking last minute, getting early check-in, and that subways/tour buses were easily accessible.

The hotel offers spacious rooms, some with kitchenettes, and is located one block from Central Park, close to shopping and restaurants. It has elevator operators and offers apartments with one bedroom.

The Helmsley Park Lane Hotel is in a prime location on Central Park South, near subway stations and within walking distance of many attractions. Some rooms have amazing views of Central Park, but many guests describe the hotel as dated and state that renovations are needed.

This budget hotel is centrally located near transportation, landmarks, and shopping, but rooms are small and may be noisy due to construction. Rooms have comfortable beds, free Wi-Fi, and laundry facilities are available.

Hotel 91 is located in the heart of Chinatown, near the Manhattan Bridge, with clean, modern rooms that include comfortable beds, flatscreen TVs, and free internet access. It is close to the subway for access to downtown and other areas, and offers a lounge with free tea and coffee.

This hotel is centrally located near Times Square, Rockefeller Center, and 5th Avenue, with subway access nearby. Rooms have been remodeled with amenities like flatscreen TVs, Wi-Fi, and iPod docks, and the hotel offers a free continental breakfast.

The Inn at Irving Place offers a unique, antique-filled experience in a historic 19th-century setting, with potential noise from a basement bar and possible disruptions due to events like bridal showers. Its location is convenient for exploring NYC, but some rooms may have maintenance issues.

The Iroquois is centrally located near Times Square, Broadway, and Grand Central Terminal, making it easy to walk, grab a cab, or take the subway to explore the city; it is a small boutique hotel with a cozy library offering computer and printer access. Some rooms are small, and some reviewers mention inconsistent Wi-Fi and slow elevators.

The Jane offers small, cabin-like rooms with shared bathrooms, suitable for short stays and solo travelers, with amenities like free WiFi, flatscreen TVs, and iPod docks. It's located in the West Village, close to the subway and various restaurants and shops, but some rooms may experience noise from the bar or street.

The Kimberly Hotel offers suites with kitchens and living areas, providing flexibility for meals and relaxation. Its central location near subways, shopping, and attractions like Rockefeller Center and Times Square makes it convenient for exploring the city.

The Lombardy offers spacious studio and one-bedroom suites with kitchenettes, individually decorated and regularly updated. It is centrally located near restaurants, shops, and transportation, making it convenient for exploring Manhattan.

The London NYC features spacious suites with free WiFi, a gym, and a central Midtown location near Times Square and Central Park. Concierge services are available, but some found them pricey and inconsistent.

The Lucerne is located on the Upper West Side, close to the subway, Central Park and many restaurants, making it easy to explore the city, and offers free Wi-Fi. Some rooms include microwaves and mini-fridges, which could be useful for quick meals.
The Manhattan Club is centrally located near Times Square, Central Park, and subway stations, making it easy to explore Manhattan. Some rooms have kitchenettes with a refrigerator and microwave.

The Mansfield Hotel is in an excellent central location, with many attractions within walking distance, and offers complimentary breakfast and free coffee; some rooms can be very small and may be noisy. There is free WiFi, a gym, and a library, and staff are generally friendly and helpful.

The Marcel at Gramercy is a modern, trendy, and stylish boutique hotel in an excellent New York location, close to subways, restaurants, bars, and attractions. Rooms are small, but clean and comfortable, with flat-screen TVs, comfortable beds, and convenient amenities like free internet access in the lounge.

The Maritime Hotel is a trendy, centrally located hotel with small, cabin-like rooms, porthole windows, and a lively bar scene, with some rooms experiencing noise from the hotel's nightlife. The hotel offers amenities such as free wifi, a business center, and bike rentals.

The Mark is located on the Upper East Side, close to museums, art galleries, Central Park, and upscale shopping. Some rooms have kitchenettes and are spacious, and the hotel offers car service and wireless internet access.

The Marmara Manhattan offers spacious apartment-style rooms with full kitchens, catering to independent travelers. Located on the Upper East Side, it provides a quieter, residential experience with easy access to the subway for exploring the city.

The Mave Hotel is centrally located near subway stops and attractions like Madison Square Park, offering easy access to midtown and downtown Manhattan. The rooms are small but clean, and the hotel provides free WiFi and a grab-and-go breakfast.

The Mercer is located in SoHo near shopping, restaurants, and subway connections, and offers room service. The hotel has a comfortable lobby open only to hotel residents, and amenities such as free wifi and a gym pass.

The Michelangelo Hotel is centrally located near Broadway and Times Square with quick access to subway lines and landmarks like Central Park and Rockefeller Center. It offers spacious rooms, a complimentary coffee and pastry breakfast, and fast elevators for convenient access.

This hotel is located on the Upper West Side, close to subway stops and Central Park, making it convenient for exploring the city. Many rooms include kitchenettes with refrigerators and microwaves, and there are grocery stores nearby for stocking up on supplies.

The Muse Hotel is near Times Square and subway stations, making it very central for getting around the city. There is free wi-fi for Kimpton In Touch members, and free coffee and newspapers in the morning.

The New York Helmsley is centrally located near Grand Central Station, Times Square, and various attractions, making it easy to walk or take public transport. It offers spacious rooms, though some find the decor dated, and provides amenities like free Wi-Fi.

The New Yorker Hotel is conveniently located near Penn Station and several subway lines, making it a great base for exploring the city. The hotel offers free Wi-Fi, quick access to transportation, and is within walking distance to many attractions like Times Square and Macy's.

The Pierre is an older, traditionally styled hotel with friendly staff, elevator operators, and a location across from Central Park that is convenient to shopping. The hotel has undergone renovations, but some rooms may be small, and some guests have noted issues with the air conditioning and noise.

The hotel is centrally located near Central Park, 5th Avenue shopping, museums, and Broadway theaters. Some rooms feature modern amenities such as touch-screen controls for lighting and climate, and iPod docking stations, and the hotel offers car service within a 20-25 block radius.

The Pod Hotel offers small, clean, and modern rooms with amenities such as free Wi-Fi, a sink, and iPod docking stations; it's located in midtown Manhattan near subway lines, making it easy to explore the city. Shared bathrooms are available and well-maintained, and there's a rooftop terrace for relaxing.
The Premier is a boutique hotel within the Millenium Broadway that offers complimentary breakfast and evening drinks. It is located close to Times Square and the theatre district.

The Ritz-Carlton Central Park offers a prime location near Central Park and Fifth Avenue shopping, with convenient access to transportation and attractions. Some reviewers mention the availability of a house car for short distances and quick valet parking.

The Roosevelt Hotel is centrally located near Grand Central Station and offers easy access to transportation and many attractions. Some reviewers noted small but clean rooms, while others received upgrades and enjoyed comfortable beds; the lobby is beautiful, and there's a bar for social activity.

The Sherry-Netherland offers unique, individually decorated rooms and suites, providing a luxurious apartment-like experience with spacious accommodations and amenities like kitchenettes. Its prime location on 5th Avenue, near Central Park and major attractions, allows for easy access to city exploration.

The Shoreham is a modern, stylish, and trendy boutique hotel in midtown Manhattan, with small but clean rooms and complimentary cappucino, espresso, tea, and hot chocolate available 24/7 in the lobby. The hotel's central location provides convenient access to shopping, museums, food, and the subway.

The St. Regis is centrally located near 5th Avenue shopping and Central Park, with butler service and staff that aim to accommodate requests quickly. Some rooms are spacious, quiet, and well-decorated, offering a luxurious and relaxing stay.

The Standard Hotel in NYC offers a hip and trendy atmosphere, with a lively bar scene and a great location in the Meatpacking District for exploring nightlife and shops. The hotel's design is modern and unique, featuring floor-to-ceiling windows with impressive views, though rooms can be small.

The Surrey offers spacious suites with kitchenettes, providing flexibility for meals and is located near Central Park and subway, making it easy to explore the city. The hotel is situated in a quiet, safe Upper East Side neighborhood.
Sylvan Guest House is located in Harlem, near a subway stop and grocery store, offering apartments with kitchens. It is a 20-minute train ride to Times Square.

The Time Hotel is located in the heart of the Theater District and Times Square, with easy access to subway lines, making it ideal for exploring the city. Rooms are small, modern and clean, with a boutique style.

The Waldorf Astoria is in a great central location, near many subway lines, and within walking distance of several attractions, but note that the rooms are generally described as old-fashioned and small. The hotel is known for drawing many business travelers, offering a business center, and is located near many restaurants for dining flexibility.

This hotel's central location near Times Square, theaters, and subway lines makes it easy to quickly access various parts of the city. Many reviewers mentioned being able to quickly check in, and staff were generally helpful.

Hotel Thirty Thirty is centrally located near the subway, Empire State Building, and other attractions, making it easy to explore Manhattan. The rooms are small but clean, and a 24-hour convenience store is located across the street.

This trendy and modern hotel is located in the Lower East Side, near subways, bars, restaurants, and shops, making it easy to explore the city and a fit for spontaneous travellers. Some rooms offer great views, though some facilities like the pool and bar may not always be open, rates vary, and noise levels can be a concern.

The Travel Inn offers a central Manhattan location near Times Square and transportation, with the added convenience of free indoor parking and a pool.  Rooms include a fridge and microwave, and the hotel is close to delis and grocery stores.

The Tribeca Grand is a trendy and stylish hotel in a convenient downtown location near Soho, Chinatown, and Little Italy, with subway access close by; the hotel has a popular bar scene and rooms offer noise-reducing systems. Some rooms have a work desk, Bose sound system, and free Wi-Fi for frequent guests.

The hotel's location near Central Park and Columbus Circle provides easy access to transportation, dining, and attractions. Select rooms feature kitchenettes with appliances, providing flexibility for meals and snacks.

The Tudor Hotel is centrally located near Grand Central Station, Times Square, and the UN, with easy access to subway and bus lines for exploring the city. Rooms can be small and may require some walking to reach attractions, but the hotel offers a comfortable base for sightseeing.

The Vincci Avalon offers a central location near attractions, subway, and shopping, with spacious rooms for NYC standards and free WiFi in the lobby. Some rooms have kitchenettes or mini-fridges, and there's a 24-hour bagel shop nearby.

W The Court is centrally located near Grand Central Station with generally large rooms for NYC; it has a hip atmosphere and lively bar scene, but some find it noisy. It provides quick room service, valet parking and easy access to midtown destinations via taxi and subway, with some rooms offering views of the Chrysler Building.

The hotel is centrally located near Grand Central Station, with easy access to transportation, and offers free Acura car service within Manhattan. Rooms are spacious for NYC standards, with comfortable beds, and modern decor; some rooms have walk-in closets and views of the Chrysler Building.

This trendy and hip hotel is located in the heart of Times Square, near theaters and transportation, and offers modern, recently updated rooms; select rooms have iPod docking stations, and comfortable beds; free wifi is available in the lobby. Some guests mention the small size of rooms, thin walls, and noise from Times Square.

This hotel has a great location near Union Square with a subway station across the street, near restaurants, shops and trains, allowing for ease of access to different parts of the city. The staff can be helpful, and the hotel also offers services such as airline check-in kiosks, and a Whatever/Whenever service for quickly getting items needed.

The Waldorf Towers offers suites with multiple rooms and kitchenettes, and some reviewers mention being upgraded to larger suites. The hotel's central location provides easy access to many NYC attractions.

The Wall Street Inn is a small, quiet hotel located in the Financial District, near subway stations for easy access to other parts of the city, and offers free Wi-Fi. It provides a continental breakfast and is close to attractions like the Staten Island Ferry and Battery Park, making it a convenient and well-connected base for exploring NYC.

The Warwick's central midtown location is within walking distance of Times Square, Central Park, and many attractions, and close to subway lines. Many reviewers noted the rooms vary in size and view and some rooms can be dark and/or noisy.

The Washington Jefferson Hotel offers a superb location near Times Square, Broadway theaters, and subway stations, though rooms are small and may be noisy. The hotel provides clean, modern rooms with comfortable beds, free Wi-Fi, and proximity to various restaurants and attractions.
Washington Square Hotel is located in Greenwich Village, near a subway stop and within walking distance of restaurants, bars, and shops. Rooms are small, and some rooms can be noisy.

The Wellington Hotel is centrally located near Times Square and Central Park, with a subway station nearby for easy access to transportation. Some rooms include a kitchenette and there is a gift shop in the hotel.

This hotel is centrally located in Manhattan, close to major attractions, with multiple subway lines nearby. It offers modern, clean rooms, a fitness center, and an owner's lounge with complimentary breakfast and evening snacks.

This hotel is centrally located near Penn Station, Times Square, and Macy's, with subway access, free Wi-Fi, and a complimentary breakfast. Rooms include a mini-fridge and microwave, but can be noisy due to street traffic.

The Wolcott Hotel is centrally located near the Empire State Building, Times Square, and Penn Station, with clean rooms and free coffee and muffins in the morning. Some rooms have views of the Empire State Building and are spacious, with amenities such as TVs and safes; lockers are available for luggage storage.

Woogo Central Park Apartments, located at 73rd and Broadway near the subway, offers apartment-style accommodations with kitchenettes, catering to longer stays and independent travelers who prioritize convenience over full hotel services. Reviews mention the building's age, basic amenities, and the option to feel like a resident, with nearby grocery stores and restaurants adding to the self-sufficient experience.

This hotel is conveniently located near Penn Station and Times Square, has clean, modern rooms, and offers free Wi-Fi. There is a restaurant, bar, and Starbucks on-site, with quick check-in, and options for grab-and-go breakfast.
